alert.note: Alert for Buena Vista; Clay; Lyon; O'Brien; Plymouth; Sioux (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 10 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Issued at 337 AM CDT Mon Apr 10 2023 After a much needed break from fire weather concerns today, things quickly ramp up Tuesday through Thursday across a significant chunk of our forecast area. Areas with lingering snow pack or recent snow melt will be less likely to be affected. However, any areas that has been snow free for several days will see near critical to critical fire weather conditions develop towards the middle of the week. After further collaboration with neighbors, the Fire Weather Watch that was in place for Tuesday has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning starting at noon on Tuesday. This is mostly due to humidity levels as low as 15 to 25 percent, strong southwest winds with gusts between 30 to 40 mph, and warmer temperatures in the mid to upper 80s. These conditions will likely persists into Wednesday and Thursday at least across portions of northwestern IA, far southeastern SD, and far northeast NE. Areas further to the north and northeast continue to be a bit more uncertain due to higher RH levels and lighter winds in parts of the area. Another round of precipitation moves into the area this weekend giving us some brief relief from immediate fire weather concerns. People are urged to exercise extreme care with respect to outdoor activities that could cause grass fires. Avoid equipment that can cause sparks near dry grass or brush. Do not toss cigarettes on the ground. Report new fires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office. .... EXTREME FIRE DANGER .... The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category Tuesday afternoon. Very poor weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that dangerous burning conditions exist. Fires will spread rapidly and show erratic behavior. Outdoor burning should be restricted. OUTLOOK FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON...The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category. The grassland fire danger product reflects fire danger for native grasses. It is not intended for cured agricultural crops, nor will it reflect conditions in road ditches which have been mowed.
